intro: Caloscordum neriniflorum, commonly known as the pink bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces clusters of small, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Caloscordum neriniflorum thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
